intro: Anemopaegma santa-ritense, commonly known as the Santa Rita anemopaegma, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
